content: round 2 change to c1 with a slip_stitch and work double_crochet 2ch double_crochet into the corner space the rest of the round is very simple double_crochet double_crochet 2ch double_crochet in corner double_crochet x 3 slip_stitch to first double_crochet of round round 3 change back to black with a slip_stitch and work double_crochet 2ch double_crochet into the corner for this round there are more stitches on the sides 3dc double_crochet 2ch double_crochet in corner 3dc x 3 slip_stitch to first double_crochet of round that s the first few rounds done - so far so simple did you remember to work the stitches on the sides into just the back half of the stitches round 2 round 3 now the treble stitches come into play to stop the instructions becoming unnecessarily complicated i m going to simplify them a bit from now on i ll leave out the bit about changing colour every round unless it s time to introduce a new contrast colour and i won t keep repeating the instructions for the corners and the end of the rounds which both stay the same throughout as you will have noticed all four sides are worked identically too so you really only need the instructions for one side i will however give you the number of stitches per side as i think that helps to check that you haven t made any mistakes 5 round 4 2dc treble_crochet 2dc 5 sts per side you should have two double_crochet stitches at each end of the side and one treble worked into the front of the middle stitch from round 2 the first stitch of each side is the one that s easiest to miss as it will be tight against the corner space my treble stitch doesn t look very central but it sorted itself out once the rest of the round had been worked don t pull the yarn too tightly when working these treble stitches or the black yarn might show through the colour work the other three sides in exactly the same way as you can see the trebles are all worked into coloured stitches this is true throughout the pattern black trebles go into black stitches and coloured ones into coloured although this may not always be the same shade of the colour round 5 2dc treble_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet 2dc 7 sts per side again the sides start and end with 2dc this happens a lot in this pattern those two black trebles are worked into the stitches either side of the coloured trebles from the last round my crochet gauge can be a bit variable so i used a patchwork ruler to check the size of my square every so often after round 5 it should be 2 ² 6 round 6 2dc treble_crochet 3dc treble_crochet 2dc 9 sts per side the trebles are worked before and after the black trebles from the last round you will be working the trebles into the front of the second
